title: Andrea Esteban
text:
Andrea Esteban Catalán is a Spanish former <a href="women%27s%20soccer">football</a> <a href="Striker%20%28association%20football%29">striker</a> who mainly played for <a href="Levante%20UD%20%28women%29">Levante UD</a> in Spain's <a href="Primera%20Divisi%C3%B3n%20%28women%29">Primera División</a>. She is currently the manager of <a href="Primera%20Divisi%C3%B3n%20%28women%29">Primera División (women)</a> side <a href="Valencia%20CF%20Femenino">Valencia</a>.
She was a member of the <a href="Spain%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Spanish Under-17 national team</a> that won its second <a href="2011%20UEFA%20U-17%20Women%27s%20Championship">U-17 European Championship in April 2011</a>, but she was seriously injured in the first match and missed the rest of the tournament.
With only 23 years old, Esteban announced her retirement after five surgeries.
